Since your site is hosted with WPMU DEV,: Since your site is hosted with WPMU DEV, we already have done the configurations steps for you. The only step for you would be to create WebP images below.
We noticed the Amazon S3 Integration is: We noticed the Amazon S3 Integration is enabled. Offloaded images will not be served in WebP format, but Smush will create local WebP copies of all images. If this is undesirable, you can quit the setup.

The following configurations are for NGI: The following configurations are for NGINX servers. If you do not have access to your NGINX config files you will need to contact your hosting provider to make these changes.
Serve WebP version of images in the brow: Serve WebP version of images in the browsers that support it and fall back to JPEGs and PNGs for non supported browsers.

Add or automatically apply the rules to: Add or automatically apply the rules to enable Local WebP feature.
Copy the generated code below and paste: Copy the generated code below and paste it at the top of your .htaccess file (before any existing code) in the root directory.
If you are unable to get the automated m: If you are unable to get the automated method working, follow these steps:
Fix the \"Serve images in next-gen forma: Fix the "Serve images in next-gen format" Google PageSpeed recommendation by setting up this feature. Serve WebP versions of your images to supported browsers, and gracefully fall back on JPEGs and PNGs for browsers that don't support WebP.
Copy the generated code found below and: Copy the generated code found below and paste it inside your http or server blocks.
Insert the following in the server conte: Insert the following in the server context of your configuration file (usually found in /etc/nginx/sites-available). “The server context” refers to the part of the configuration that starts with “server {” and ends with the matching “}”.
If you don't know where those files are,: If you don't know where those files are, or you aren't able to reload Apache, you would need to consult with your hosting provider or a system administrator who has access to change the configuration of your server.
Look for your site in the file and find: Look for your site in the file and find the line that starts with <Directory> - add the code above that line and into that section and save the file.

Please note: Some servers have both Apac: Please note: Some servers have both Apache and NGINX software which may not begin serving WebP images after applying the .htaccess rules. If errors occur after applying the rules, we recommend adding NGINX rules manually.
Smush can automatically apply WebP conve: Smush can automatically apply WebP conversion rules for Apache servers by writing to your .htaccess file. Alternatively, switch to Manual to apply these rules yourself.
We've automatically detected your server: We've automatically detected your server type is %s. If this is incorrect, manually select your server type to generate the relevant rules and instructions.
